p: Very little is known about the replicative capacity, immunogenicity, and correlates of protective immunity for low-pathogenicity H6 influenza viruses in mammals. H6 AIVs have been isolated from humans, pigs and a dog [ 67]. H6N2 along with H6N6 are viruses that are found to also replicate in mice without preadaptation, and some have acquired the ability to bind to human-like receptors [ 20].
